title: Charlottesville 'Very Fine People' Statement
summary: After neo-Nazi 'Unite the Right' rally where Heather Heyer was killed, Trump said there were 'very fine people on both sides,' widely condemned for creating moral equivalence between white supremacists and counter-protesters.
keyFacts: Neo-Nazi 'Unite the Right' rally in Charlottesville where Heather Heyer was killed
Trump said 'very fine people on both sides'
Also stated 'I'm not talking about the neo-Nazis and the white nationalists; they should be condemned totally'
Widely condemned for creating moral equivalence between white supremacists and counter-protesters
Initial response took two days and was seen as inadequate
Backlash led to resignation of several business leaders from White House advisory councils

sources.text: Washington Post: What Trump said with his 'very fine people' comments vs. what he meant
